newsitem.title: POLAND: Poland to raise utilities prices on January 1.
newsitem.headline: Poland to raise utilities prices on January 1.

text.p: Poland's government-controlled prices of electricity, natural gas and heating will go up as of January 1, as envisaged in next year's budget draft, the finance ministry said on Monday.
It said in a statement that electricity prices would rise by 17 percent in 23 electricity distribution areas and by less than 16 percent in the remaining 10.
The ministry said the gas price would increase by 18 percent, the only rise next year, and central heating by 10 percent. The heating price will go up by another five percent in July.

The statement said the increases were necessary because the value added tax for the energy products would grow to 17 percent from the current 12 percent next year and because costs of their import, excavation and delivery were rising.
The rises are above the government's target for cutting overall annual inflation to 13 percent in December next year from 19.1 percent in November.
